description.narrative: Support to Alleviating Hunger, Improving WASH $ Strengthening Protection for Women in Borno is joint project managed by both Christian Aid (UK) Nigeria country Programme and Norwegian Church Aid (NCA) for the lake chad region supported by the foreign Affairs ministry in Norway. This section outlines the nature and nomenclature of interventions for the SAHW project. Based on the humanitarian response priorities of the Borno State government and the 2017 Humanitarian Response Plan prepared by UNOCHA, this project consists of two main components namely: • Component 1: Water, Sanitation & Hygiene (WASH). • Component 2: Gender-based Violence (GBV) • Component 3: Food Security & Livelihoods (FSL). the specific objective (SO) for this component is, “Affected communities; IDPs, returnees and host communities receive life-saving WASH assistance appropriate and relevant to their needs.”. To fulfil this objective, three key outputs have been developed for this component: • Output 1.1 (O1.1): “affected men, women, boys and girls have safe, equitable and sustainable access to sufficient quantity of water for drinking, cooking and maintaining personal and domestic hygiene”. To fulfil this objective, three key outputs have been developed for this component: • Output 1.1 (O1.1): “affected men, women, boys and girls have safe, equitable and sustainable access to sufficient quantity of water for drinking, cooking and maintaining personal and domestic hygiene”. Under this output, we aim to repair 30 handpumps and construct 25 new ones in host communities across the target LGAs. • Output 1.2 (O1.2): “affected men, women, boys and girls have access to safe, sanitary and hygienic living environment through the provision of sanitation services that are gender-appropriate, dignified, safe, clean and functional sanitation facilities”.
